1W0283








[solution]		 _____ 1W0284








[solution]      [Next]
  • 1W0281
    • 1. Nf3+ forks the King and Queen.
    • (The pawn is
    • pinned.)

    		_____
  • 1W0282
    • 1. Bb6 pinning one rook to another.
    • Whtie eventually
    • won.

  • 1W0283
    • 1. Bf6+ skewers the king and rook
    • on d8. Not 1. dxe6
    • Rxd1+

    		_____
  • 1W0284
    • 1. Nf6+ forks the king and queen
    • because the pawn on g7 is pinned.

    1W0285








    [solution]    		 _____ 1W0286

    1W0287








    [solution]    		 _____ 1W0288








    [solution]      [Next]
  • 1W0285
    • 1. Nxh6+ forks the king and queen.
    • The pawn on g7 is
    • pinned.

    		_____
  • 1W0286
    • 1. g6 mate. Note that moving the
    • king closer will
    • stalemate.

  • 1W0287
    • 1. Nf8 mate! Thanks to kabal on
    • fics for showing me
    • this one.

    		_____
  • 1W0288
    • 1. d6 is a double attack in the
    • knight at c7 and the
    • Rook at a8.

    1W0289








    [solution]    		 _____ 1W0290








    [solution]      [Next]
    1W0291








    [solution]    		 _____ 1W0292








    [solution]      [Next]
  • 1W0289
    • 1. Nxd6+ forks the king and queen.
    • Note that the pawn on e7 is
    • pinned.

    		_____
  • 1W0290
    • 1. Nf6+ wins the queen on d5 with
    • discovered attack by the bishop on
    • f3.

  • 1W0291
    • 1. Ne4+ forks the king and pawn and
    • stops the pawn
    • from queening.

    		_____
  • 1W0292
    • 1. Re8 pins the bishop to the king.
    • It will be
    • captured next move.

    1W0293








    [solution]    		 _____ 1W0294








    [solution]      [Next]
    1W0295








    [solution]    		 _____ 1W0296








    [solution]      [Next]
  • 1W0293
    • 1. Nc6 forks the Queen and Rook.
    • Note that the rook
    • on e6 is pinned.

    		_____
  • 1W0294
    • 1. Ne8+ forces the king to
    • move away from the defense of the
    • bishop

  • 1W0295
    • 1. Bg5 forking the two rooks and
    • Black's attack was practically
    • non-existant.

    		_____
  • 1W0296
    • 1. Qe8 + seperates the king from
    • the rook as the rook will drop if
    • it moved to f8.

    1W0297








    [solution]    		 _____ 1W0298








    [solution]      [Next]
    1W0299








    [solution]    		 _____ 1W0300








    [solution]      [Next]
  • 1W0297
    • 1. Nd5!! uncovers an attack on the
    • queen wich has no safe square to
    • move to.

    		_____
  • 1W0298
    • 1. Qxg4 wins because the Bishop on
    • e6 is pinned to
    • the king by the rook on e1.

  • 1W0299
    • 1. Bf1 and the Black Queen has no
    • where to hide. It
    • will be taken no matter what.

    		_____
  • 1W0300
    • White may still be lost, but he
    • should at least play
    • 1. Nb6 forking the two rooks
